name: name
name of schema containing tabl: name of table the statistics object is defined o

name: name
name of schema containing tabl: name of schema containing extended statistics objec

name: name
name of schema containing tabl: owner of the extended statistics objec

name: text
name of schema containing tabl: expression included in the extended statistics objec

name: bool
name of schema containing tabl: if true, the stats include values from child tables, not just the values in the specified relatio

name: float4
name of schema containing tabl: fraction of expression entries that are nul

name: int4
name of schema containing tabl: average width in bytes of expression's entrie

name: float4
name of schema containing tabl: if greater than zero, the estimated number of distinct values in the expression. if less than zero, the negative of the number of distinct values divided by the number of rows. (the negated form is used when analyze believes that the number of distinct values is likely to increase as the table grows; the positive form is used when the expression seems to have a fixed number of possible values.) for example, -1 indicates a unique expression in which the number of distinct values is the same as the number of rows

name: anyarray
name of schema containing tabl: a list of the most common values in the expression. (null if no values seem to be more common than any others.

name: float4[]
name of schema containing tabl: a list of the frequencies of the most common values, i.e., number of occurrences of each divided by total number of rows. (null when most_common_vals is.

name: anyarray
name of schema containing tabl: a list of values that divide the expression's values into groups of approximately equal population. the values in most_common_vals, if present, are omitted from this histogram calculation. (this expression is null if the expression data type does not have a < operator or if the most_common_vals list accounts for the entire population.

name: float4
name of schema containing tabl: statistical correlation between physical row ordering and logical ordering of the expression values. this ranges from -1 to +1. when the value is near -1 or +1, an index scan on the expression will be estimated to be cheaper than when it is near zero, due to reduction of random access to the disk. (this expression is null if the expression's data type does not have a < operator.

name: anyarray
name of schema containing tabl: a list of non-null element values most often appearing within values of the expression. (null for scalar types.

name: float4[]
name of schema containing tabl: a list of the frequencies of the most common element values, i.e., the fraction of rows containing at least one instance of the given value. two or three additional values follow the per-element frequencies; these are the minimum and maximum of the preceding per-element frequencies, and optionally the frequency of null elements. (null when most_common_elems is.

name: float4[]
name of schema containing tabl: a histogram of the counts of distinct non-null element values within the values of the expression, followed by the average number of distinct non-null elements. (null for scalar types.
